item.title: Loud roadworks Monday at 23:23, 8th September
item.description:
There is unacceptably loud roadworks being done on a Monday evening. We noticed loud drilling at 21:30. Since then roadwork has been consistently loud. There is currently (23:30) a loud construction vehicle and truck running with intermittent drilling. On a weekday after 9pm is completely unreasonable!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Grosvenor Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks noise on a Monday at 23:27, 8th September
item.description:
There is loud drilling and trucks working on a Monday night. The drilling began around 9:30pm and as of 11:28pm they are continuing to drill. This is unnacceptable. We can hear the sound with our windows closed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130, Grosvenor Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Dangerous wavy road surface tarmac - Accidents risk, 8th September
item.description:
There is a wavy tarmac surface at this part of the road. It creates vehicle loss of control, increasing the risk of accidents and vehicle damage (including buses passing by). It also exacerbates water pooling during rain, which increases the potential for aquaplaning. It's caused by an unstable asphalt mix and excessive horizontal stress from traffic, leading to compromised vehicle stability, reduced control, and an increased risk of accidents. It is also extremely dangeruous to be on the top deck of the bus and getting down as the bus approaches the nearby stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 400, Salter Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dulwich park - gates fully open at 10pm!, 8th September
item.description:
I already reported several time the issue of Dulwich Park gates - on Court Lane side - being left open in the night. Tonight at 10 PM all the gates, including the large one, were fully open. Needless to say that it is unsafe to leave the park with all the gates open throughout the night. Can the Council ensure that the gates are securely closed on time each night? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carriage Drive, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet
